seo.title: Nano Banana Pro – 4K Text-to-Image & Editing | MaxVideoAI
seo.description: Generate 2K and 4K stills with Nano Banana Pro. Google Gemini 3-based fidelity, multi-image references, and commercial licensing directly in MaxVideoAI.

overview: Nano Banana Pro is the Gemini 3-powered upgrade for brands that need legible text, consistent characters, and export-ready stills. Draft 2K explorations, then flip to 4K when the frame is locked—all inside the MaxVideoAI image lab.

hero.title: Nano Banana Pro – 4K Text-to-Image & Editing
hero.intro: Studio-grade still generation and semantic edits — built for campaign assets and clean typography.

items.title: Keyframes & reference boards before video animation

promptStructure.title: Prompt mini-guide
promptStructure.quote: 4K [subject] in [environment], [lighting/lens], include text "[copy]" in [font mood], brand palette [colors].
promptStructure.description: Spell out subject, setting, lighting, lens, typography, and how the frame will be used. For edits, explain what should stay locked and what can change.
steps: Typography or logos (exact copy, placement, style)
Edit instructions if referencing existing stills

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Draft at 2K for speed, rerun final approvals at 4K.
Use seeds to lock framing, especially across multi-image campaigns.
Upload 1–4 references when you need on-brand wardrobe, props, or faces.
For signage, include exact copy plus notes on casing and alignment.

prompts.title: 4K product hero (text → image)
prompts.prompt: 4K editorial hero of a matte black electric motorcycle on a wet rooftop at night, neon skyline reflections, include the copy "FULL TORQUE" in luminous sans-serif type on the billboard behind, cinematic 35mm depth of field.

prompts.title: Launch poster (text → image)
prompts.prompt: Vertical event poster for a fintech summit, clean Swiss layout, teal and charcoal palette, accurate headline text: "NEO CAPITAL LIVE" and subhead "PARIS 2025", soft volumetric backlight.

prompts.title: Reference cleanup (image → image)
prompts.prompt: Using this studio product shot, relight it with softer gradients, remove dust and fingerprints, add a faint reflection, and place it on a neutral 4K background for packaging.

prompts.title: Multi-image consistency (image → image)
prompts.prompt: Blend these brand portraits into a cohesive autumn campaign: warm tungsten rim light, matching wardrobe palette, subtle falling leaves particles, keep each person’s identity intact.

faqs.a: Yes. You can generate up to 4K (up to 4096px). 4K is $0.39/image (2K is $0.20/image).
Pricing is per image: $0.20 at 2K, $0.39 at 4K.

faqs.q: How many images can I generate per run?
How many reference images can I use?
faqs.a: In the UI: keep it lightweight for control. fal endpoints can support higher multi-image counts (up to 14) depending on the route.
Yes. Nano Banana Pro supports natural-language image editing without manual masks, and editing is priced per edit.

faqs.q: Is it cleared for commercial work?
faqs.a: fal lists commercial use via partnership for this model family.

pricingNotes: $0.20 per 2K image, $0.39 at 4K. Pricing shown live inside the workspace before you render.

custom.heroSupportLine: Best for brand-ready stills, product family consistency, and reference boards before you animate in video engines.
custom.whyTitle: Why Nano Banana Pro is powerful
custom.heroDesc1: Generate 2K or 4K stills with laser-sharp text and tone, right next to your video engines.
custom.heroDesc2: One wallet, one prompt lab, and full logging—no separate Fal account needed.
heroHighlights: Readable text and layouts||Built for marketing assets where typography actually needs to hold up.
Semantic edits without masks||Describe the change; keep the rest consistent (composition, lighting, identity).
Reference-driven consistency||Great for keeping a product/character “on model” across a full set.
Follows detailed briefs better||Handles multi-part art direction with fewer random surprises.
custom.whatTitle: How Nano Banana Pro works here
custom.whatIntro1: Choose Generate or Edit, set num_images (1–8), pick your aspect ratio, and decide whether you need 2K or 4K outputs.
custom.whatIntro2: Lock your prompt structure, add references if needed, preview the live price chip, and hit Generate.
whatFlowSteps: Select Nano Banana Pro in the Image Lab
Pick Text → Image or Image → Image
Set batch size and (optionally) seed for consistency
Add references or upload brand stills if you’re editing
Review the price chip ($0.20 per image, $0.39 at 4K) and run
custom.galleryIntro: Recent 2K/4K stills and edits crafted for campaign boards and product reveals.
custom.tipsIntro: Nano Banana Pro is most predictable when you treat the image like a layout: composition first, then lighting/style, then typography (if any).
strengths: Start with composition and hierarchy (where the subject sits, what’s the focal point, what stays clean).
For typography: provide the exact copy and placement (“headline top-left, 2 lines, high contrast”). Keep text short.
For consistency: use references with roles (“Ref A = product shape, Ref B = lighting, Ref C = palette”).
For edits: write “Change X, keep Y” (keep framing, lighting, identity; change only the requested element).
Iterate at 2K, then switch to 4K for finals.
boundaries: Batch runs are 1–8 images at a time.
Reference/image limits depend on the route: the UI is intentionally capped, while fal endpoints can support higher multi-image counts in advanced workflows.
safetyRules: No sexual content, and nothing involving minors.
No hateful, harassing, or graphic-violence content.
Don’t impersonate real people or public figures; use consent for any likeness.
Don’t include private personal data (faces of non-consenting people, addresses, phone numbers, documents).
Some prompts or reference images may be blocked by provider safety filters.
custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Nano Banana Pro Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Gemini 3 Pro Image rewards structured briefs with clear composition, typography, and edit intent.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: resolution + aspect ratio are set in the UI - your prompt controls subject, composition, lighting, style, and edit instructions.
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Name the subject and composition first.
Specify lighting, lens, and style anchors.
For edits, say what to change and what to keep.
promptingEngineWhy: Structured briefs yield cleaner text and layout.
No-mask edits work best when you specify what to change and what to keep.
Multi-image references help keep products on-model.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = style control. Use for precise, repeatable looks.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + key traits.]

Composition:
[Framing + angle + background.]

Lighting:
[Key light + mood.]

Style:
[Photoreal / illustration / palette.]

Typography (if needed):
[Exact copy + placement.]

Edit (if editing):
[Change X, keep Y.]

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "studio brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Brand brief:
[Goal + audience + format.]

Subject + materials:
[Details + textures.]

Layout + hierarchy:
[Grid, spacing, focal point.]

Typography:
[Font vibe + hierarchy + exact copy.]

References (optional):
[Ref A controls style; Ref B controls product.]

Edits (if needed):
[Change list + keep list.]
